page.title: 17FARM & LANDSCAPE CHANGES-1
page.content: While this area has remained rural, with clumps of trees dotting the open fields,there have been many changes. The open grassland of the{Common,}with its varied flowers,was ploughed in the 1940s,leaving only the broad overgrown verges along part of the Rye Hill road Closure first of the Dunmow rail link, serving Felsted,then closure of the refining plant there,has made sugar beet an uneconomic crop hardly grown. Membership of the EEC in the 1970s led to increases in{cereal growing-}first wheat then barley-then to a rapid fall in dairying and{ploughing of grassland and recently planting of{large areas {of oilseed rape,}turning most of the landscape golden in late May and early June with its flowers.Some farmers are now looking for a substitute for this crop when the inevitable surplus leads to controls on rpoduction.
